intro: Brongniartia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's brongniartia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Brongniartia palmeri is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
